messages.title: Mercury, chasing the quicksilver
messages.description: An investigation into the illegal mercury route in the Amazon
messages.share_msg: An investigation into the illegal mercury route in the Amazon
messages.intro_lead: An investigation into the illegal mercury route in Guyana and Suriname
messages.intro_text:
Mercury is one of the driving forces behind small-scale gold mining in the Amazon. The liquid metal is considered essential to extract gold sparks. But mercury pollutes fragile ecosystems and harms human health.

One of the hidden doors to mercury entering Amazonia is the Guiana Shield region. The legal import of this toxic substance through Guyana makes it the link for smuggling to neighboring countries like Suriname, Venezuela, and Brazil, where the sale is prohibited.

In this investigation, we dive into mercury's underworld, an obscure sector that few know, which is itself a multi-million dollar industry.

messages.map_text:
“MERCURY”, is a production of InfoAmazonia, a network of journalists who investigate the main environmental issues in the nine countries of the Amazon. The investigation was conducted in four countries over one year. The work was done in partnership with journalists from Armando.Info in Venezuela and Fantástico (TV Globo) in Brazil. Along with this special investigation, we will launch a documentary directed by Tom Laffay.

The entire production was supported by the Rainforest Journalism Fund of the Pulitzer Center and IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature) The Netherlands committee.

Versions of the stories are also published by Knack (Belgium), Stabroek News (Guyana), De Ware Tijd and UnitedNews.sr (Suriname), besides stories by our partners in Brazil and Venezuela.
